crop_diseases.name: Aphid
crop_diseases.definition: Small, sap-sucking insects that cause leaf curling, yellowing, and stunted growth by feeding on plant juices.
symptoms: Clusters of small insects on new growth
recommended_treatments: Spray insecticidal soaps or neem oil
Apply systemic insecticides for severe infestations
Use strong jets of water to dislodge aphids
preventive_measures: Introduce beneficial insects like ladybugs and lacewings
Avoid excessive nitrogen fertilization
Monitor plants regularly for early detection

crop_diseases.name: Mite
crop_diseases.definition: Tiny arachnid pests that cause bronzing, stippling, and webbing on leaves, leading to defoliation and reduced plant vigor.
symptoms: Tiny moving specks visible with magnification
recommended_treatments: Apply miticides specifically labeled for crop use
Use horticultural oils or insecticidal soaps
Increase humidity to discourage spider mites
preventive_measures: Maintain proper irrigation to prevent water stress
Regularly wash plants to remove dust that attracts mites
Introduce predatory mites as biological control

crop_diseases.name: Stem Fly
crop_diseases.definition: A pest that lays eggs in stems, causing wilting, yellowing, and tunneling damage, weakening crop structure.
recommended_treatments: Apply systemic insecticides at early growth stages
Use seed treatments containing imidacloprid
Remove and destroy infested plant parts
preventive_measures: Practice crop rotation
Adjust planting dates to avoid peak fly populations
Use trap crops to divert pests from main crop

crop_diseases.name: Black Rust
crop_diseases.definition: A fungal disease that creates reddish-brown pustules on stems and leaves, later turning black, reducing grain yield.
symptoms: Reddish-brown pustules on stems and leaves
Pustules turn black as they mature
recommended_treatments: Apply fungicides containing triazoles or strobilurins
Time applications at first sign of disease
Remove alternate hosts like barberry plants
preventive_measures: Plant resistant varieties
Early planting to avoid peak infection periods
Maintain field sanitation by removing crop residues

crop_diseases.name: Brown Rust
crop_diseases.definition: A fungal disease that forms small, orange-brown pustules on wheat leaves, reducing photosynthesis and yield.
symptoms: Small, round, orange-brown pustules on leaves
Pustules primarily on upper leaf surface
recommended_treatments: Apply protective fungicides like mancozeb
Use systemic fungicides for established infections
Follow regional disease forecasting systems
preventive_measures: Plant resistant varieties
Avoid dense planting that increases humidity
Rotate crops to reduce inoculum buildup

crop_diseases.name: Yellow Rust
crop_diseases.definition: A fungal disease forming yellow-orange pustules in stripes along wheat leaves, leading to stunted growth and yield loss.
symptoms: Yellow-orange pustules arranged in stripes along leaf veins
Early infection can affect entire leaves
recommended_treatments: Apply fungicides at early disease onset
Use strobilurin or triazole fungicides
Follow up with additional applications if conditions favor disease
preventive_measures: Plant resistant varieties adapted to local conditions
Avoid early planting in high-risk areas
Monitor fields regularly during cool, wet conditions

crop_diseases.name: Smut
crop_diseases.definition: A fungal disease where black, powdery spores replace grains, leading to complete yield loss in severe infections.
symptoms: Black, powdery spore masses replacing grain heads (Loose Smut)
Long, gray-black streaks on leaves and stems (Flag Smut)
Stunted plants with twisted flag leaves (Flag Smut)
Complete destruction of grain heads (Loose Smut)
recommended_treatments: Use certified, treated seed
Apply systemic seed treatments containing carboxin or tebuconazole
No effective treatment once infection is visible
preventive_measures: Plant resistant varieties
Use hot water seed treatment for small seed lots
Practice crop rotation with non-host crops

crop_diseases.name: Common Root Rot
crop_diseases.definition: A soil-borne disease that darkens roots and lower stems, causing stunted growth and early plant death.
symptoms: Brown to black discoloration of subcrown internodes
recommended_treatments: Apply seed treatments containing metalaxyl or thiram
Improve drainage in affected fields
Adjust planting depth to promote quick emergence
preventive_measures: Rotate with non-cereal crops
Avoid planting in cold, wet soils
Use clean, disease-free seed

crop_diseases.name: Leaf Blight
crop_diseases.definition: Characterized by elongated brown lesions with yellow halos, leading to early leaf death and reduced grain production.
symptoms: Elongated, brown lesions with yellow halos
Lesions that merge to form large necrotic areas
recommended_treatments: Apply foliar fungicides containing propiconazole or azoxystrobin
Time applications to protect flag leaf
Remove infected crop debris
preventive_measures: Plant resistant varieties
Practice crop rotation
Ensure balanced fertilization

crop_diseases.name: Blast
crop_diseases.definition: A severe fungal infection that causes gray or brown lesions on leaves, leading to wilting and crop loss.
symptoms: Bleaching of spikelets on wheat heads
Gray-brown lesions on leaves with diamond shape
recommended_treatments: Apply triazole and strobilurin fungicides preventatively
Remove infected plants
Follow strict quarantine measures in affected regions
preventive_measures: Plant resistant varieties where available
Adjust planting dates to avoid warm, humid periods
Practice crop rotation with non-host crops

crop_diseases.name: Fusarium Head Blight
crop_diseases.definition: A fungal infection that causes premature bleaching of wheat heads and produces harmful mycotoxins in grains.
symptoms: Pink or orange spore masses on infected spikelets
Shriveled, chalky white or pink kernels
recommended_treatments: Apply triazole fungicides at flowering stage
Harvest infected fields separately
Clean grain to remove Fusarium-damaged kernels
preventive_measures: Plant moderately resistant varieties
Rotate with non-host crops like soybeans
Minimize crop residue through tillage in high-risk areas

crop_diseases.name: Septoria
crop_diseases.definition: A fungal infection causing brown lesions with black spots, spreading from lower to upper leaves, reducing photosynthesis.
symptoms: Irregular brown lesions with yellow margins
Black pycnidia (fruiting bodies) visible within lesions
Lesions that coalesce to form large necrotic areas
Progression from lower to upper leaves
recommended_treatments: Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or azoxystrobin
Time applications to protect flag leaf
Use multiple fungicide modes of action to prevent resistance
preventive_measures: Plant resistant varieties
Reduce crop residue through rotation or tillage
Avoid early planting in areas with high disease pressure

crop_diseases.name: Tan Spot
crop_diseases.definition: A fungal disease causing small, dark brown lesions with yellow halos, expanding to form necrotic areas on leaves
symptoms: Small, dark brown spots that expand into tan lesions
Coalescence of lesions under favorable conditions
recommended_treatments: Apply fungicides containing strobilurins or triazoles
Time applications to protect upper leaves
Remove or bury crop residue
preventive_measures: Plant resistant varieties
Rotate with non-host crops
Practice tillage in high-risk situations

crop_diseases.name: Mildew
crop_diseases.definition: A fungal disease that forms white, powdery patches on leaf surfaces, hindering photosynthesis and weakening plants.
symptoms: White, powdery fungal growth on leaf surfaces
recommended_treatments: Apply sulfur-based fungicides or triazoles
Use systemic fungicides for established infections
Improve air circulation by avoiding dense planting
preventive_measures: Plant resistant varieties
Avoid excessive nitrogen fertilization
Rotate crops to reduce inoculum levels

crop_diseases.name: Healthy
crop_diseases.definition: No disease detected; the plant is in optimal condition for growth and yield.
